intro: Alosemis, commonly known as the tropical milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, orange-red flowers that attract pollinators such as butterflies and bees. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. Alosemis is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
